Dear Ibu Tjongsuling, 

Warmest Greetings from Four Points by Sheraton Balikpapan. 
Thank you for choosing to stay with us especially during this difficult period. We truly appreciate your business and value your honest feedback. 
First and foremost, I and the team would like to sincerely apologize for falling to meet your expectations during check i process. 
We pride ourselves in providing an exceptional product and service to all guests, however in your case, it was not the case. There is no excuse for what I am sure has left a negative impression about the hotel. 

While I understand that nothing I could do would be able to take back the experience you had, I truly appreciate if you would allow us another opportunity to rebuild your confidence by serving you again. 
We hope this experience will not alter your confidence in us. We hope you would still give us an opportunity to provide a token of apology and to regain your trust by serving you better in the future. 


Best Regards, 
Muhammad Jufri Sakka

text:
We were in a group tour to go scuba diving at Derewan Island. Due to the fires we could not continue on our journey.
We stayed two night in the wonderful brand new hotel in Balikpapan only a few minutes from the airport while we tried to sort out the mess.
The staff were so very friendly especially Ika in the restaurant. The menu was great and reasonably priced. The arrival of the meals was quite slow but we weren’t going anywhere soon.
The room was well appointed with a very comfortable king sized bed, toiletries and complimentary water.
The pool is great and there is also a gym.
At a reasonable tariff and free shuttle to the airport our stay was very pleasant.’
title: Brand New Hotel, Very Friendly Staff

owner_response.text:

Thank you for choosing the Four Points by Sheraton Balikpapan for your recent travels to Balikpapan. 

Commitment to service and guest satisfaction is a main focus and we are delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay. The pride and dedication our hotel team takes in providing exceptional customer service to our valued guests speaks strongly to our company’s core values, “good service at a fair price.” Your feedback regarding delivery food was slow is well noted. I have shared to FB Leader for future improvements.

text:
This newly opened property is just so extraordinary. The location is closed to Sepinggan Airport and the hotel provides complimentary shuttle for guests. The small street access is a bit narrow but it was paid off the moment I arrived and greeted by the staff. 
Check-in was extremely smooth and as Platinum Bonvoy Member, I was upgraded to the suite. I would say, the best suite for Four Points level in Indonesia! 
The breakfast was superb! Internet connection was fast!
I really enjoyed my stay and surely will be the only option in Balikpapan.
Thanks for Marissa who noticed me by my name. 
Overall, I was impressed with Four Points by Sheraton Balikpapan. I really hope the quailty of property and services will be maintained as time goes.
Thank you for my great stay!

Riko

text:
Hospitality 10 (let's hope it was not only because it's a new hotel 😁🙏)
Room 9,5 (the Premium Suite is spacious with a bathtub and a coffee machine, but the Deluxe King's not really large)
Amenities and Media 10 (our rooms have an iron and the board, even a scale! a smart TV with Miracast too.)
Facilities 9 (forgot to visit the gym tho 😁 too bad the pool is too small. glad that every time we visited there, only several people swam).

And for the breakfast:
A wide variety of good foods... The most important thing is the taste. They all tasted so good 👌🏻

Staff friendliness 10 (they tried hard to find a high chair for our baby, and I like how they talked to us)
Food taste 10 (and I like the chef in the egg section made my omelet req precisely as I wanted it ❤️❤️ so rare, cause after every hotel, only in Tentrem I got that kind of egg right 😅)
Type of Foods 9 (Maybe you want to add more desserts type, such as ice cream 😆, and more yogurts and the fruits for Salad)
Design 10

Minor drawbacks:
- tiny flaking and peeling paint on the ceiling in the Premium Suite (maybe they painted it a bit carelessly).
- the bathroom was very cold and we couldn't set the temperature. oh, and no locks.
- no freezer in the mini fridge. it's a 4-star hotel, even a 3-star got one.
- the direction signs at the parking lot were not many and obvious. The staff at the parking lot was just chilling on his chair.
- checking out was super fast, but the receptionist just asked us to make sure if we didn't leave anything behind. they should've checked on the room first before they let us go. isn't it the standard procedure?
- I asked about the mobile key and the mobile check-in and check-out with the app, but it seemed they didn't really know or weren't really prepared.
- a slow draining sink in the bathroom.
- I requested an extra feather pillow for each room upon my booking on the app, but we didn't get them upon our arrival (only the extra towels).

Overall, their hospitality is superb and I'd love to recommend Four Points by Sheraton Balikpapan to others.
title: Cozy Premium Suite

text:
As the title indicates, it's one of the best Four Points in the Marriott portfolio. No matter as a member or ambassador, they do try to go out of their way to make you feel VIP, even when the staff might have a little trouble with communication in both English and Bahasa.

The suite is lovely and was upgraded as an ambassador elite to the suite on request. (FP BPN didnt pre-upgrade me both times.) Not my favorite Four Points suite, but it's roomy, decorated nicely, and has a beautiful bathtub. I've had two different suites over two stays: one in the corner and another between two other suites. (FP BPN only has five suites and they're all on the 10th floor facing the pool and courtyard.) The living room is cute with their color scheme, but in both suites, the walls feel too bare. In the corner suite, there is a little bit of empty space that could be utilized, but I still like the living room as it's stylish and practical. The bedroom of the suite won't have any differences between each room. The headboard is beautiful as it's part of the wall along with the end tables being stylish matching the rest of the furniture. The bathroom is nice, but the sink design is just terrible in use, but nice looking. I would prefer to change the sink entirely so it doesn't make me all wet while just running the water. The shower is big enough. While I like the transparent door between the living room and bedroom, I wish it was frosted as it would allow more privacy if the living room is in use. While the closet on the other hand needs a door too.

F&B at FP BPN is one of the best too. When I tried chef Boy's cooking the first time, I fell in love. His culinary skills are top notch. I would personally follow him to another hotel just to try his cooking again. They do allow special requests for new dishes you want made, but this is where communication is lacked as sometimes when you requests special dishes or alterations to dishes, communication to other staff working another day isn't there. It's like, a special request is only known by a few staff, but not all. However, Gusti knows how's to resolve issues and make sure they don't happen again showing how well fit he is on a management level. Him along with the rest of the restaurant staff, they are my favorite.

Reservations and front office all have lovely friendly smiling faces, but sometimes it's tough to communicate what you might want. Numerous times, I've had to ask someone, like Gusti, to help me out resolving some issues. That shouldn't be the case as he is F&B, but he is so helpful and communicates so well that he is my go to for bigger issues. That being said, knowing Marriott systems (in comparison to other properties), more detailed orientated, and a more coherent environment would allow them to be more ironed out.

Housekeeping, does a swell job keeping the room clean. Sometimes in a hurry, but that is normal for housekeeping as it's a demanding position when there are many rooms occupied.

Overall, I will always return to FP BPN as it's lovely. Sometimes there have been major issues, but most of the time they have been ironed out. I hope for many future stays whenever I am in Balikpapan.
title: One of the best Four Points in the Marriott portfolio

text:
Very conveniently located airport in nice local surroundings (not one of those clinical, non descript cold airport hotels) Staff super friendly and helpful with good English. Rooms modern and clean, comfortable beds, great pillows; nice restaurant. 
A note to Western lady travellers re the pool: This is a Muslim country - all the ladies and girls were wearing Islamic swim attire. I went into the pool in my one piece swimming costume and felt very inappropriately dressed. Nobody said anything and people were all smiles and greeted us but still...I felt disrespectful and ignorant of their culture.  I should know better as we work and live in Cambodia and I always respect how people are supposed to dress in public. 
I would definitely recommend this hotel.
title: Very good airport hotel
